history.content:
I'm taking 170 this semester, and I'd say as long as you've done some proofs before you'll be fine. Have you taken 61b though? That class is much closer to 170, and if you're comfortable with the algorithmic side of that material then 170 should be fine (if you haven't taken 61b as well as 70 the class might be a bit challenging but you should be able to pick up everything you need to know). Probability is not relevant to 170.

-------

Confirming that the importance as a prereq of 70 for 170 is primarily in proof-writing, and secondarily in mathematical maturity. You may want to review some proofs (perhaps looking at CS70 readings/assignments) as preparation if you want, but you're quite possibly fine without. And also agreeing that 61B as an important prereq.

I'm taking 170 this semester, and I'd say as long as you've done some proofs before you'll be fine. Have you taken 61b though? That class is much closer to 170, and if you're comfortable with the algorithmic side of that material then 170 should be fine (if you haven't taken 61b as well as 70 the class might be a bit challenging but you should be able to pick up everything you need to know). Probability is not relevant to 170.

• so i've already taken math 55, although more than a year ago, so I'm super rust on actually doing proof style math, but the thing is I have done it before --> it's somewhere in my head.  
  • Although the broad nature of the course is similar, I understand material wise math 55 and cs70 are a bit different <-- potential cause for concern?
  • all the shenanigans of taking 70 after math 55 (or vice versa) with transcript and stuff <-- tedious/annoying
  • ideally would like to not spend the money, although willing to if necessary

 I was wondering how cs170 is for someone is pretty average at math but does have 55 under his belt 

One thing to note is I for sure don't remember anything about is probability if that is at all relevant. 

Any advice and feedback is greatly appreciated!
Thank you

Edit: forgot to mention that I will have 61a/b as well
